The difficult task of identifying Ukrainian soldiers killed at the front
subhead: The widespread use of drones along the Ukrainian front has left the bodies of soldiers unrecognizable, making the work of already overwhelmed forensic doctors at Dnipro's morgue even more challenging.

Georgia's ruling party wins local polls as mass protests flare
subhead: The ruling, populist Georgian Dream party won local elections with more than 80% of the vote. The typically low-key local elections had acquired high stakes after months of raids on independent media, the introduction of laws restricting civil society and the jailing of dozens of opponents and activists.

title: India spared from Gen Z uprisings
subhead: In spite of various vulnerabilities, India's size, diversity and federal system have made it difficult for large movements with the potential to topple the government to form.

title: If you love Eugène Boudin, you will love Honfleur
subhead: The Impressionist painter has a museum named after him in this popular Normandy tourist town, where he was born. Many other artists have been drawn here by the ever-changing light of the estuary.

title: Hollywood grapples with deep division over Israeli films
subhead: As the antiwar film 'The Sea' is set to represent Israel at the Oscars in 2026, the American film industry is torn apart by petitions and public stances.

Trump turns the government shutdown into a political weapon
subhead: The American president considers the partial halt of government operations − triggered by budget disagreements between Republicans and Democrats − an opportunity to further dismantle the federal state and win a PR war against his opponents.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

title: France's global news agency AFP buckles under pressure from rising populism
subhead: Targeted by several authoritarian governments, Agence France-Presse – one of the three leading global news agencies – has found itself struggling financially in the face of a fragile media sector, changing news consumption habits and the rapid rollout of AI.
